subject: Education
title: Growth Mindset: Believing You Can Improve
description: A 60-second lesson on Growth Mindset: Believing You Can Improve.

hook.text: 'I'm just not a math person.' That belief alone lowers your math score.

buildup.text: Carol Dweck distinguished fixed mindset (talent is born) from growth mindset (talent is built).

discovery.text: Students who believe ability is malleable persist longer and recover faster from failure.

twist.text: Praise for effort works; praise for being 'smart' backfires when tasks get hard.

climax.text: Mindset interventions are smallâ€”sometimes just a 25-minute readingâ€”but effects are real.

punchline.text: What you believe about your brain changes how it performs.

quiz.question: Why does praising 'smartness' backfire?
options: It creates a fixed mindset that avoids challenge to protect the label
It only works for younger children
